page.title: 02ART FORMS IN N.BRISTOL
page.content: {Blaise House Museum}has collections of pictures & artefacts;implements both domestic & agricultural used by the house reflecting its history from 18th century.There were local blacksmiths, millers,thatchers,carpenters,masons, cordwainers,sawyers,gunstock-makers. At{Vine House Henbury}lived Pountney, founder of Bristol pottery.At Henbury House lived Richard Champion porcelain maker & friend of Edmund Burke.In the 1980's in Westbury a lady potter makes & sells her pots in the Old Bakehouse. Some local schools have kilns to fire the childrens'work.In the area, W.I.& church groups make flower arrangements & numerous other artefacts.Graffiti is a popular artform especially on the east side of our area.{Adult Education {Centres}offer a range of craft lessons & there is an abundance of homecrafts, more in the west of the area.
